intro: Oreobliton cardosoi, commonly known as the Canary Islands stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in sunny, well-drained environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring or early summer. Oreobliton cardosoi is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a rare and endemic species.
